alert.note: Alert for Athens; Meigs; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Meigs, southwestern Washington, southeastern Athens, northwestern Wirt and Wood Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Forked Run State Park, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Belpre, Elizabeth, Coolville, Vienna, Washington, Mineralwells, Lubeck, North Hills, Belleville, Reedsville, Walker, Little Hocking, Blennerhassett, Davisville, Greencastle, Morristown and Rockport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 160 and 181. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
